snippet: The rising Spanish flamenco-soul singer Pitingo was to have made his U.S. debut Friday night at the Manhattan Center, and the avant-garde Czech theater troupe known as Tantehorse had a run at a theater in the Washington D.C. area cancelled.
abstract: The rising Spanish flamenco-soul singer Pitingo was to have made his U.S. debut Friday night at the Manhattan Center, and the avant-garde Czech theater troupe known as Tantehorse had a run at a theater in the Washington D.C. area cancelled.

headline.main: Visa Troubles Force Two European Acts To Cancel U.S. Gigs
